lines.raw: August 3, 10:00 AM, District Court, Courtroom No. 2
Judge: The court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Barry Bingo.
Payne: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.
Ace: The, um, defense is ready, Your Honor.
Judge: Ahem. Mr. Detective? This is your first trial, is it not?
Ace: Y-Yes, Your Honor. I'm, um, a little nervous.
Judge: Your conduct during this trial will decide the fate of your client. Murder is a serious charge. For your client's sake, I hope you can control your nerves.
Ace: Thank... thank you, Your Honor.
Judge: ... Mr. Detective, given the circumstances... I think we should have a test to ascertain your readiness.
Ace: Y-Your Honor. (Gulp... Hands shaking... Eyesight... fading...)
Judge: This test will consist of a few simple questions. Answer them clearly and concisely. Please state the name of the defendant in this case.
Ace: Um... the defendant... is me, right?
Boss: Detective! Have you completely lost your mind? Focus! The defendant is the person on trial! You're his lawyer!
Ace: Um, er, eh? Oh yeah, right! Eh heh heh.
Boss: This is no laughing matter! You did pass the bar, didn't you?
Judge: Sorry, I couldn't hear your answer. I'll ask once more: [go back]
The defendant? Well, that's Barry Bingo, Your Honor.
Judge: Correct. Just keep your wits about you and you'll do fine. Next question: This is a murder trial. Tell me, what's the victim's name?
